timeline.message:
Add 'Retryable', a custom class to do retries

Investigating other retry libraries, none quite give us the API we would
like to retry a boolean supplier until it returns true. This update
adds a 'Retryable' that provides (for now) a fixed backoff between
retries.

Execute websocket pings with 3 retries & 3 second backoff

If the ping send fails, we'll get disconnected (disconnect is
at 60s, we send a ping every 45s). We could increase the ping
frequency at the cost of greater load. Instead we use a simple
retry to give any failures a few more attempts up until
pretty close to the 60s mark. If we are unable to send a ping
by then, then we would expect the websocket connection to
server to be closed. When that connection is closed, we will
show a pop-up to the user that the connection was lost
(so there is no need to inform a user when a ping fails,
just when the connection is lost will we notify the user).

.

timeline.bodyHTML:
Suggested change
for (int i = 0; i < maxAttempts; i++) {
final Boolean result = taskRunner.get();
if (result != null && result) {
return true;
}
final boolean wasLastAttempt = i + 1 == maxAttempts;
// only sleep if there are more attempts left
if (!wasLastAttempt) {
threadSleeper.accept(fixedBackOff);
}
}
return false;
for (int i = 1; i < maxAttempts; i++) {
if (taskRunner.get()) {
return true;
}
threadSleeper.accept(fixedBackOff);
}
return taskRunner.get();

Is nicer IMO

Since we are within a system boudary, using strongest type possible is good (ie: avoid strings and numbers and use value objects instead, generally use strong typing)

Good point that perhaps a setting would want to turn off retries, but IMO YAGNI on this one.
My biggest concern is that 'max attempts' and 'max retries' were ever to be confused. A setting of '1' could seem like "oh yeah, one retry".
